input.belief: i have terrible posture and  my back is going to be hunch backed. i always slouch so much and i dont know if im overthinking it or if my posture is actually bad
input.consequence: my back hurts and i get self conscious. maybe its because im too short so im leg doesnt touch the ground

permanence.insight: This makes it feel like you believe your posture is always bad and won't improve.

pervasiveness.detectedPhrase: my back is going to be hunch backed
pervasiveness.insight: The belief makes it seem like this one problem will affect your entire future body and how you feel about yourself.

personalization.insight: You blame yourself and your habits, but also wonder if maybe you’re overthinking or if it’s about your height.

analysis.emotionalLogic: It makes sense to feel self-conscious and worried if you believe your back will always hurt and your posture will ruin your health.

suggestions.evidenceQuestion: Are there times when your posture is better, or days your back doesn't hurt as much?
suggestions.alternativesQuestion: Could your back pain also be from something else, like sitting in a certain chair or not moving enough during the day?
suggestions.usefulnessQuestion: If you keep believing your posture will never improve, how does that make you feel about trying to fix it?
suggestions.counterBelief: Maybe my posture isn't perfect now, but there are things I can try to help my back and improve over time.
